website_summaries.verdict: These LED lights work well on most off roading vehicles of all types including ATVs and trucks/jeeps.
pros: The pair of high quality off road lamps use LED bulbs for a long lasting performance and more illumination in pitch black environments
Lights run cooler than other options available
cons: Installing and mounting the lights can be difficult depending on the type of vehicle and its surface area

website_summaries.verdict: The best budget boat lights to buy for better placement flexibility around the boat.
pros: Powerful LED lights can be placed in a variety of spots around a boat or other equipment
Spot beam does a good job of illuminating the area in front of the light
cons: Light beam may not be bright enough to be used as solo spotlights without additional lighting

customer_reviews.title: They worked pretty well (definitely not as bright or as tough as ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these about a year and a half ago to mount on the front of my truck for herping (looking for snakes and lizards after dark). They worked pretty well (definitely not as bright or as tough as much more expensive ones). After a year and a spell of wet weather, one died (there is some sort of internal short - I took it apart and tested - water had gotten in). Given the price, I just bought another pair to swap one in. It seemed better than buying more expensive ones, and I sealed these with silicone, so hopefully it won't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric LoPresti

customer_reviews.title: Great when they both worked.
customer_reviews.text: These lights worked great at first, but now one of them flickers for a few minutes and then quits working completely. I have checked my wiring and connectors and everything is fine there. We'll see if they stand behind their 2 year warranty. Update, they haven't replied to my message still have 1 light that works when it wants, most of the time it doesn't work at all. I would not recommend buying from this company they apparently do not stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Urie

customer_reviews.title: Junk don't buy them
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for . A friend asked me to order them and install them , They are cheaply made. If you want to keep them for more then a month take them apart as silicon them. They fill up with water . Rusted hardware after 2 weeks, rattle , nothing tightens. And they are Brite if you stand in front but no projection . We ended up taking them off and going with Baja's best of the best. If you want a cheap set for say a work light or I ended up using them on my 28 foot camper , installing them on the back to light up a small area while back Nh in
customer_reviews.author: Chris i.

customer_reviews.title: BEST PURCHASE YOU CAN MAKE FOR YOUR JEEP WRANGLER
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving these lights 5 stars because for the price they are def the best item yet that I bought from Amazon and I've bought a lot of items from Amazon. The built feels like $200 lights and they are more brighter then my current HID head lights. The truck needs no more lights after these Really happy with the product. Way better then expensive brands but remember you have to buy brackets and wiring
customer_reviews.author: Jeep E

customer_reviews.title: Mounting bracket bolts tapped wrong
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking light but two out of the four I ordered the holes for bracket bolts were not tapped deep enough for the bolts to go all the way in. If you try to tighten bolts they strip off threads in mounting bracket. Poor Quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Coover

customer_reviews.title: Weak lighting
customer_reviews.text: Installed on the front of a small pick up and I wanted to use them just for plain jane fog light but they are super weak and they fail to light up anything. You cant tell from inside the cab looking out if they are even or off, they simply do nothing for me at all and I have tried 2 pairs and nothing has changed at all.
customer_reviews.author: WildBorego

customer_reviews.title: Failed in Less Than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Used these for landscape lighting, which is one of the recommended applications. Less than 2 months after installed, running them for approximately 5 hours per night one of the units has 4 of the 6 LEDs failed. They worked well at first, but the short lifespan makes me hesitant to order more or recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: --brk

customer_reviews.title: Sub par
customer_reviews.text: Update: after 3 months, they filled with moisture They're alright at best. They're not the brightest compared to the ridgids I had. I use these for reverse lights and they don't spread so much. Of course wiring is super simple as always.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Chapman jr

customer_reviews.title: did not last a tank of gas.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these 2 years ago for another project, and did not use them. They sat in the box until a few weeks ago, when I mounted them. It was cold so I did not adjust them until yesterday only to discover that one light was not working. Checked all connections, and the light is dead. I even took the light apart and put power to the circuit board and it still would not work. The one light did not last a tank of gas. I would not buy again and will be looking for another brand and maybe spend a couple of bucks more.
customer_reviews.author: comando

customer_reviews.title: Very bright. Nice size
customer_reviews.text: Very bright. Nice size. My complaint is the mounting bracket makes the light shine slightly up or down regardless of mounted horizontal or vertical. I had a perfectly vertical surface and a perfectly horizontal surface on the front of my truck. Regardless of position, the light was a little too high or too low for my use. I created metal wedges to allow me to have the light shine ever so slightly down while still allowing me to see down the road. Otherwise these are very nice and brighter than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G. Maner

customer_reviews.title: Great lighting at a small price
customer_reviews.text: Just installed these on my golf cart. Easy to install and all hardware is included. I did order the wiring harness with relay that made the install super easy. After installing the lights to the front of my cart, I installed the relay, switch and wiring. Works perfectly. The lighting is just what i needed to see better at night and to be seen. Both items cost around $25 and was an excellent spend. Not sure of quality but figure a 2 year warranty will cover any issues. If they go out after that, another $14 for lights will be worth it. Seriously bright lighting with good reach to them.
customer_reviews.author: K Yake

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, but great little lights!
customer_reviews.text: When I bought these I knew that for under $20 they were going to be inexpensive lights. I rebuilt mine to hold up longer after reading reviews from other users. I took mine apart, sanded each housing and applied truck bed liner to each housing, ran a bead of clear silicone around the lens, used stainless steel hardware to prevent rust. I installed mine as ditch lights at the hood/cowl level on my truck, and they are just the right brightness to see off the angle I need/wanted for off road driving. After a month they seem to be holding up well to below zero temperatures, and the vibration of off road driving. I’d buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: DesertRoads

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Rugged
customer_reviews.text: Installed them and next day went out and put them to (ab)use. They got smacked with tree branches, run through the mud, miles of gravel, rained on and eventually washed off with the hose. They held up like a champ with little more than a couple of scuffs. I've read reviews that the casings tend to oxidize and if that does happen I'll brush them off and put on a coat of high temperature spray paint. For the price though, I mean c'mon they are worth it and work really well. I have them mounted to existing bolts and will remount when the pod mounts get here.
customer_reviews.author: kristofuh

customer_reviews.title: VERY Sharp
customer_reviews.text: These lights are being used on receiver hitch of my 2018 F150. I installed these for when I load and unload for the hardware that is needed to teach my college classes. I now have the bed rail LEDS along with these lights installed at the hitch. Wired them into independent switches using the parking lights circuit as the feed. (Parking lights have to be on to power the lights but this ensures you don't leave them on and kill your battery.) I was impressed by the price and how sharp they are. The parking lots are dim at best but when I flip the switches, I can light up everything around my truck,
customer_reviews.author: George Sharp Jr

customer_reviews.title: MOISTURE IN LIGHT FIXTURE
customer_reviews.text: ORDERED ON 02JUNE2020. SHIPPED FAST AND RECEIVED FAST. INSTALLED VERY QUICKLY AND EASILY. USED ON MY 2014 F350 AS FOG LIGHTS AND HEADACHE RACK REVERSE LIGHTS. I ORDERED 2 SETS. IT IS NOW 21OCT2020, AND ONE OF EACH SET OF LIGHTS HAVE MOISTURE IN THEM. I PARKED MY TRUCK IN MY SHOP AND JUST RAN THE LIGHTS FOR A GOOD WHILE. MOISTURE WENT AWAY, BUT RETURNED ON THE NEXT RAIN. PRODUCT SAYS THAT THEY ARE MOISTURE/WATER RESISTANT. I EMAILED THE COMPANY LAST THURSDAY AND STILL HAVE NOT RECEIVED ANY RESPONSE.
customer_reviews.author: monst3r02110

customer_reviews.title: Good lights but crappie mounting brackets
customer_reviews.text: Lights themselves are awesome. Very bright and durable. I live in south america where it is always hot and humid. I mounted them on my truck and after almost 2 years of use, no moisture has entered the casings. However, there is a big flaw with the mounting brackets: they tend to break under normal use, sometimes detaching from the lamp housing but mostly just cracking for no apparent reason. I have been trough 4 attachment brackets already (i used 2 others from another Nilight Led Bar that I purchased) and its pissing me off now that I have to fix them with tie wraps. Company needs to fix these
customer_reviews.author: dolan

customer_reviews.title: Nice light overall
customer_reviews.text: Good for close up, directional lighting. More of a flood light at a distance but still lights up the area. Simple two-wire installation. Install tip: Run the bolt through the bracket, a 3/4" flat washer, a 3/4" rubber washer, the mounting surface, another rubber washer, another flat washer, and finally a locknut. Snug up the locknut just enough. The rubber washers will hold to the surface (and seal the hole) while the flat washers and locknut will allow you to turn the light/bracket as needed without scratching your paint.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Sweet bumper
customer_reviews.text: This bumper looks awesome! Be warned though, taking off the old bumper is a royal pain. Make sure you have a rotating ratchet adapter. There are 8 nuts to unscrew, and if your vehicle is like mine then you'll need pb blaster and some patience. You'll need to be careful when putting the fog lights back into the housing as the wires only stretch so far. I ended up taking off the electrical tape to gain a couple more inches in the wiring, easy fix. I used a torque wrench to put the new one on and used 80 # torque.
customer_reviews.author: Rudie can't fail

customer_reviews.title: Lights are high Quality but Quality control is starting to lack.
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that Nilight makes an amazing long lasting product. I have lights similar to these but just a little smaller and they are mounted on the bakc of my vehicle and have been exposed to dirt, rain, ice, etc for 2 years and still work perfectly. I did not even get a chance to mount this set of lights because it was missing parts. Quality control standards need to be a set a little higher and I would give this product a higher review. This items is very well built and uses high quality metals.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny no doubt
customer_reviews.text: This lights are bright and illuminate very well to b so small. I wired them in to my back up lights on my truck and boy do they make a difference with tinted dark windows i can see behind me now where i could hardly see before. My only concern is weather but we'll see in time. Good brackets and SS bolts not bad for the price. Very happy with them. They also feel and look well made.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal for great lights!
customer_reviews.text: These lights are fantastic, especially for the price. Extremely bright, easy to install, and worth every penny. I would say these are just about comparable to some of the more well known high end auxiliary lights out there. They light up a HUGE area and are absolutely perfect for night riding and setting up camp after dark. Easy to aim and adjust, just make sure you locktite the bolts as they can slip out.
customer_reviews.author: D. Campi

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware! Not plug and play, gotta prep it.
customer_reviews.text: I should've paid closer to attention to this when it arrived. It's damaged for my liking which probably explains the lower price. I'm going to try to straighten the louvers. And after that, just like other buyers/owners going to seal the lense edges and area where wire comes in. Going to spray paint to make it more durable and to rust protect incl the screws and mounts. Lastly, seal the lenses just like headlight lenses.
customer_reviews.author: PapaRenSan

customer_reviews.title: Look great and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and wire. Read some of the other reviews where folks mentioned water might leak into the lamps. So I took a little silicone and sealed all the areas to be sure. These are very bright and use very little power. I installed the optional relay wiring harness with switch. I wanted these independent of my front lights. Look great. Nice set for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Fab

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable value/cost ratio
customer_reviews.text: I got these today and was surprised by how solid the lights were built. And they look expensive. Granted that they do not really use 18W each, and they are not terribly bright, but for my use case, they are perfect. If you go to a local hardware store and just buy the bolts, nuts and metal brackets that came with the light,s you would probably spend close to $12. You cannot expect to have the brightest lights at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Y. W.

customer_reviews.title: No good for me.
customer_reviews.text: Returned. I did not like the the brackets and the way to adjust them. Seemed like they would come loose after a while and also felt that if I tightened them too much they would break. Also the light pattern was not equal, one of them had a bit of yellow color to it almost as if the leds where about to burn out. Spent more money on some from Harbor Freight and they are brighter and and have a better light pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: Very bright for the price
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good for the price. We have a lot of deer in our area, so needed these to supplement the high beams to light up the sides of the road to see those pesky deer, poised to jump out in front of us ;-) The only minor downsides so far are 1) one of the screw heads sheered off before it was fully seated (but the 3 remaining screws still hold it tight). 2) the bracket is adjustable, but doesn't quite allow the light to point out at 90 degrees if mounted horizontally. another 1/4 inch of adjustment in the bracket would have been perfect. Having said that, still 5 stars for the cost and the brightness
customer_reviews.author: 7 and counting

customer_reviews.title: Enclosed attaching hardware will rust
customer_reviews.text: Gotta admit that I hadn't had a chance to run the wiring and install a switch to hook mine up yet, but they looked nice on the front of my CR-V! The only comment I can make at this point is that, as some others have mentioned, the nuts and bolts that come with these lights will start to rust after several months. I purchased stainless steel hardware (which cost me almost as much as the lights did!) which I'll use to re-attach these, and when I do I should also wire everything up so that they'll be functional lights rather than decorative items!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Cooke

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LIGHT!!!!  Multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: Love these lights great add on to anything DC. I have one on my ATV one on my sons mini Bike. I purchased these same lights on the past and I keep one as a flash light in my tool bag. Just use my drill battery. Anything from a 9v to 36 volt. I posted a picture on my son's mini bike I just used a 9v battery. The battery has a lot of hours and still goes.
customer_reviews.author: darrenr16755

customer_reviews.title: COVLED-19 Virus
customer_reviews.text: I just received my lights in the mail and assembly. looking at where the wire harness goes into the pod, one light has a glob of hot glue in it and the other has nothing. Chinese garbage. I guess I am supporting child labor, but come on, even a 5 year old chinaman knows to use proper weatherproofing assembery.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: These lights aren't really the best for long range lights
customer_reviews.text: These lights aren't really the best for long range lights, they don't throw the light downrange very far compared to many other lights out there, but for the money you pay for these things, they're not bad at all. I'd say they're about the same as the brights on both my vehicles. I won't be buying another set for long range lights, but I'll more than likely end up buying another set for something else since the spread pattern and lumen output is definitely usable for a few other things I need lighting for. The picture is just a single light illuminating the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Kang

customer_reviews.title: IP67? Not...
customer_reviews.text: These lights are like Gremlins... Keep them away from water. Great if you intend on building an indoor DIY 12v shop light, not so great if you plan on putting them on a vehicle that will be exposed to any kind of adverse weather. The light housings are far from waterproof. They are relatively bright though.
customer_reviews.author: AvidAmazon'r

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Set I've Bought - new design no longer has bracket
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with 1st set I bought last year. Great swivel bracket that I could mount under an opening in my grille on the bottom of my bumper. However, the set I bought last week arrived and the new version does not have a bracket. Unless you make your own (I did), you could only drill a hole in the top of your bumper and mount it there. Lights themselves are great. Just enough extra light out away from the city.
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: Don't last long
customer_reviews.text: Bright little lights, easy to fit in small areas. Sadley they only last about 6 months for me. I installed them on my rear truck bumper (1st pic), just hooked them into my reverse lights. They really light up the world but don't last long. Second and third pic are of the one I just replaced and you can see still looks like new. Fourth pic is showing one diode still working and 2 others glow a bit. The rest are out. Oh well, I'll move on.
customer_reviews.author: M. Robino

customer_reviews.title: Light me up Scotty
customer_reviews.text: Light work as described but within one week of mounting them the supplied relay failed. When I replaced it with one I bought the original one looked like it was used and in poor condition and was covered with corrosion. Also be careful not to bump the lights because the mounting devise is weak. The little mounting bolt is held in place by the cooling fins and these fins move easily. It was easily repaired by sliding them back into position to hold the bolt but I was surprised at how flimsy the system was. Other than that I like them fine they're super bright and the price is right
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: How can you compete ...
customer_reviews.text: How can you compete with amazon with these prices - I won’t give it 5 stars solely on the fact I just got these. Initially, upon opening the package I was impressed with the lights and for the price they do everything you expect (and more). Install went well, but the bolts that hold the lights on the bracket suck and I only got 7 out of the 8 bolts I needed. I was racketing one bolt and it sheered off all of a sudden. So words of advice when you are threading the bolts just be causious on the poor quality of the bolts. I really cannot complain though for you he price.
customer_reviews.author: D0m

customer_reviews.title: One Good Light, One Bad Light.
customer_reviews.text: Very excited to receive these lights and installed them on the first day. After the second installation one of the lights was crooked and detached it from my brackets to find out that the bottom bolt on the lights was crooked, causing the light to lean to the left. I unscrewed it and put in another nut on the bottom, but the same problem has occurred. So I have one perfect straight light and one crooked light on my truck. Would really like some customer service so I can fix this problem. For now, 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Agate Family

customer_reviews.title: Great bumper but damaged during shipping
customer_reviews.text: My package came looking like it fell off a few trucks before it got to me The bumper is good quality however, it came beat up with chip marks and a rust spot. I know it's a bumper for a Jeep and will get chipped and scratches I was just hoping to be the one to do the damage and not have it come looking used. I would have returned it however it took two weeks to get to me and I didn't want to wait another two weeks for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Foglights for my Subaru WRX
customer_reviews.text: I wired these up to the stock foglight switch in my 2003 WRX and they work great. They are as bright or brighter than my stock headlights and definitely lighter, smaller, and brighter than the OEM foglights. After reading reviews I decided to open these up as soon as I got them to seal them up better for waterproofing. However, when I opened one up, it looked to be very well sealed. So well sealed in fact that I didn't even touch it, I just put it back together and threw them on my car. Two weeks in, already driven through some rain and zero issues and zero moisture inside the lights.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: BRIGHT
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually leave reviews but I have to say these pods are just amazing, I have ordered 3 pairs and I'll be ordering the fourth one soon. These are really BRIGHT, great value for the money. Quick update: I have just noticed moisture came inside one of the pods, this is the first time I have any issues with this pods, so I'll have to remove some stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Levy

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn’t be advertised for SAFE towing
customer_reviews.text: Sold as a class 3 hitch, meaning it should be able to handle a tongue weight up to 600 lbs. Used it to tow less than 300 lbs and the bumper bent away from the frame. From a safety standpoint, 0/5. My cargo carrier is hanging less than a foot away from the ground and if my Jeep wasn’t lifted it’d be close to scraping the ground. Materials used are not quality. You can see in the video that the metal flexes when I push down on my cargo carrier. Only positives would be the LED lights and aesthetics. Would not purchase if you actually plan to use it as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright and narrow beam-good off road spots
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a different NiLight brand light and mounted it on the windshield post. I swapped them out for these since these are very directional, like a spotlight, which is what I wanted for off-road lighting. These are well built and easy to install. I have them on a Jeep JK and does not create any whistling at highway speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in CT

customer_reviews.title: Installed on my boat
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a set of old school halogen flood lights on my boat with these. Pretty easy to install and wire up. Nice and bright too. When compared to the price of true marine flood lights, you can't beat these. I like the look and design of these lights much more than the halogens they replaced. See pics and video. Update, 1 year later. These lights have held up quite well installed on the boat. The boat is on a lift and is exposed year round to the elements. Both lights have very minimal rust on the supplied hardware and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Ronyon1

customer_reviews.title: Price and quality are great.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and nice lighting. They are solid. Complaints are probably more user than product. With the bracket that comes with it, the bolts are too long and would have contacted the hood. The light to mount could be better designed, the wire leads are short and were on the same side so symmetrical look is out the window. Also the leads are in the way of one of the bolts. Really these are the OCD part of me. Quality and brightness seems great just nitpicking here. For the price they are awesome. Although I have prime, shipping was slow.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Great value - shine bright
customer_reviews.text: I installed these at the rear of my truck so I would have better lighting when backing up or trying to hitch up in the dark. I was able to use my vehicles auxiliary switches so connection was pretty easy. I have had these for 4 months now. No signs of water leakage and they still shine great. Really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RON

customer_reviews.title: Died after just a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I bought these at the end of July and finally installed them on my jeep bumper in October. Only used them a few times. Tried them last night and neither one worked. Checked the wires where they are connected and they are getting 12.5 volts. Can't believe they are dead already.
customer_reviews.author: Tim O

customer_reviews.title: Nice and bright
customer_reviews.text: I added these as backup lights to my F150. One light has stopped working altogether. First it was 3 of the 6 leds stopped then the other 3 went out. To be fair I haven't looked to find out if there was a wiring issue. Shouldn't be as I soldiered and used shrink tubing and placed inside a wiring loom. I'll update as soon as the weather permits. Update, water some how got inside of the one.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M

customer_reviews.title: Great Cheap utility lights
customer_reviews.text: I mounted these lights on my MTD Yardman riding mower, to VASTLY improve upon the stock headlight. These lights are SO bright that they turn my yard into daylight when mowing at night! For the price, these light are impressive with MASSIVE heat sinking ability. Can't comment on how long they will last, only had them for a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Adelaide Zvaigzne

customer_reviews.title: What do you expect for $12.....
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure why everyone gives these such high reviews. Maybe it because they are only $12.00. Anyway if you want purple dim light that doesn't illuminate anything particularly well then these are for you! I took them off after a week and replaced them with ProComp's. I will use one of these as a backup light maybe or just toss them altogether. Like i said if you want purple dim light these are for you.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R.

customer_reviews.title: Very good value. Nilight customer service is great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in January of 2019. They lasted til February 2020. I’m a bit tougher on my vehicles than most people. They see a lot of time off road and in very damp areas. The wiring inside the old lights ended up getting wet and corroded. Contacted Nilight about the 2 year warranty and they sent me a brand new set overnight. I’m very impressed with Nilight and will use them again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Ross

customer_reviews.title: Decent set of fog lights - good throw and crisp white light.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was relatively easy. Not sure whether the mounting screws are stainless steel or not. The light throws a beam a good 50-70 yards, are crisp white with a very slight tint of blue. Gets warm after running for a while, but doesn't get hot. The wire was about 10 inches long, giving plenty of room without having to splice additional wiring. The only down side is one of the lights doesn't mount evenly because of poor quality control on the bracket, the light doesn't sit level, but overall not too bad. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Made good fog lights
customer_reviews.text: They work fine and have increased nightime visibility. The install hardware was incomplete in one package. The problem was corrected. The biggest drawback is moisture is not completely sealed out. We have had 2 now that have gotten moisture inside behind the lens, and one light that failed after moisture got in.
customer_reviews.author: katagaria1

customer_reviews.title: A very bright idea
customer_reviews.text: I installed these lights facing to the rear of my side-x-side and got the exact result I had hoped for. The installation was as very quick and easy. Because of the low amperage draw it did not require a relay , the switch I used was good for 20 amps which is more than enough. The lights provide just the right illumination for performing task at the rear of the sxs and when not in use looks really great with out being to”gaudy “ I recommend them highly.
customer_reviews.author: Doug White

customer_reviews.title: they are very bright and look great. The wiring is long enough to reach the ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my cracked factory fog lights on my 2000 TJ with these, they are very bright and look great. The wiring is long enough to reach the factory fog light wiring harness plugs from the stock bumper mounting location. I just cut/spliced on the factory plugs from the old fog lights using weatherproof connectors. The only negative I can see is they are probably too bright to run as factory style fog lights.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the same as big brand websites, cheaper price.
customer_reviews.text: Came wrapped pretty well, heavy duty box. Went on (with help) easy. You’ll have to wire your own led’s up, they give you enough wire to splice into. You can see in the pics (sorry they’re sideways) how it looks with stock flares, which I did remove after the pic and replaced with metal to match the bumper texture.
customer_reviews.author: M. N.

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, poor performing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one set, the LEDs starting going out one by one. Those got stolen, so I thought I’d give them another chance since I welded brackets in place to accommodate the spacing they required in the light hole of my bumper. With a few months they started doing the same thing. Individual LEDs going out, one by one, and even coming back one after having been out for a while then going out again. Poor internal circuitry that leads to VERY premature failure.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Bryant

customer_reviews.title: These Smack ;)
customer_reviews.text: So what a very beautiful girl would say “these smack.” These are extremely bright that could definitely light up a 5 foot area like a spot light and then medium light for an added 15ft in each direction. I think one light would be perfect for a motorcycle but you definitely have to go the two for a dirt buggy or any four wheel vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: casey schott

customer_reviews.title: Bright addition to my dual sport
customer_reviews.text: I added these to my DR650, along with a pair of 7" LED light bars when I replaced the lousy headlight. I wired these with the flood LED for the high beams and they are amazing together! Riding out in the hills last week at night, I could light up the entire road and 30+ feet on each side with these. They're better than any highbeam on any vehicle I've ever owned. Best part is that both of these and the two LED light bars are still lower wattage than the factory headlight.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Long

customer_reviews.title: Amazing brightness
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this low-cost set just to use on the front of my golf cart for occasional night use. They are powered by a small 12 volt lawn mower battery. Tonight I took the cart out around my farm and the little lights were amazing. They are almost as bright as the headlights on my GMC truck. I cannot get over what a good value they are and I would recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: pam dorman

customer_reviews.title: These are nice, bright lights
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, bright lights, that are a bargain for the price. They're very bright, and rival lights that cost 3-4 times as much. There is one thing to double check with these. On the bottom is a mounting block that attaches the light to the mount. It's held in with a socket head cap screw. This came loose on one of them. I'm installing two more pair on another vehicle, and I'm going to double check that this is tight, and if it's loose on any of them, they're all getting some thread locker, and re-tightened. I had to do that on my first pair. Otherwise, good value, good lights.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: A great price, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: A great price, easy to install, and work well so far! They were easy to splice into my old fog light wires, and were definitely brighter. Its also rained hard a few times since I've had them and i haven't had any issues so far. They're not extremely bright, and the light is focused into more of a beam than expected, but they are definitely a great addition. For driving on the roads these are great because they're not quite enough to blind oncoming traffic, but for off road purposes I would have gone for the next size up for another $10. Since I'll be using them for both, 4/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mark mcmillan

customer_reviews.title: Water inside the light!
customer_reviews.text: Water got inside the lens and burned the LED light bulbs. Bought 2 pairs and it didn’t last long and had to replaced with second pairs due to water got inside. Then I had to replaced the wires and switch that I also purchase from amazon. Wasn’t happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nilight spot driving lamps - very bright and tough - great entry level off road lamps
customer_reviews.text: These are some very tough fog lamps for the price. The aluminum housing is very durable and seems to be well assembled. The leds very easily overpower my halogen headlights on my Jeep. Mind you my Jeep is very short and rides rough, but the lights have started to wobble a little while driving but hey, last weekend I was rock climbing and mud bogging and log jumping etc... I was NOT easy on them so it is very understandable at this low price range to have broken something inside. I actually had the conversation that for this price I can replace them 5 times in 4 years and not feel bad at all about breaking them.
customer_reviews.author: EdGrimly

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a year but barely help with light and half the lights stopped working. But they are cheap so dont expect great quality. I will not buy again.the ad says there is a 2 year warranty but there is no way to use it and get the lights replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Taryn

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: These look good in light up the area okay. If you're looking for Budget pod lights these are them don't expect much visibility with them as the lumens are pretty low. I will be replacing them with better more high-powered lights. I originally purchased these to see if I would even like them as ditch lights on my 4th gen 4Runner.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Wells

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal and work great! No idea how someone could give negative review. A total steal for $12!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this product based on some of the negative reviews. These lights work awesome. No idea how they can sell a pair of them for $12. I would image the shipping from China cost more then the product itself. I'm very happy. To the people giving negative reviews - these lights cost $12. Yes $12!! You can't even buy a LED flashlight for $12. Total deal!!
customer_reviews.author: Who, me?

customer_reviews.title: Different installation brackets than shown
customer_reviews.text: These do not come with the installation/adjustable brackets as shown. They are the same 4” square lights as pictured. Could not install as needed so I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Sabotaged69

customer_reviews.title: Just, OK.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know where do I start? While the lights are bright and seem of a decent quality, the brackets are pure garbage. The screws are annoying to secure into the light housing because they are so small, and getting all 4 screws secure before the light shifts is another challenge. My biggest complaint is that the wiring comes out the side of the light, right in front of one of the screw holes. Would have been better if the wiring exited the rear of the light.
customer_reviews.author: autumn

customer_reviews.title: The units a pretty bright and seem pretty solid at the first inspection
customer_reviews.text: The units a pretty bright and seem pretty solid at the first inspection. Installed them tonight but was pretty disappointed when the mounting bolts snapped off in the block. Two snapped bolts out of eight. Also thought they might come with a left and right but they don't. Makes cable management different for each side of a vehicle. We will see how well they hold up on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Andy A

customer_reviews.title: Bright, easy on power, easily mountable
customer_reviews.text: Bought two pairs of these lights for bowfishing. Got a bolt to fit the cam hole in the bow and mounted these lights to it and ran power wires to the deep cycle battery. It changed the way we bowfish. very bright and stays bright for hours while trolling the lake. Hardly uses any power. After cruising the sand pit for 5 hours, with all 4 lights running the whole time, and the battery running all the lights AND the motor, it was still at 80% when I checked it with the charger. So, bright, versatile, hardly uses any power... Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: JESSE STUHR

customer_reviews.title: How to INSTALL
customer_reviews.text: It would be nice if they would send instructions on how to install these lights instead of only a white box that says ( MADE IN CHINA ) !!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JLW

customer_reviews.title: I use these on our Backhoe and they work great.
customer_reviews.text: I use these on our Backhoe That sees very little rain and they work great. They are inexpensive lights that work, If they were installed on something that seen a lot of water you would probably want to take them apart and seal them up better, The assembly technique and the seals are suspect and for the price you should expect that. Overall very happy with this purchase and I feel they were worth exactly what I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: Fredrick C.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these lights mounted on my truck bumper for not even a month and they already are showing signs of water inside of them. One of them just quit working today. With the line of work i do i need a lot of light when backing my truck up at night for visibility and these are not holding up. Definitely ordering another product that will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Schillinger

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these lights! They are super bright and easy to mount. The wires are well made and very well insulated. My only complaint is the wire needs to be stripped out more than it is pre made and that’s a challenge on how high quality the insulation is. Other than that it is a 5 star product
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Parker

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good. VERY bright. Great cheap lights
customer_reviews.text: Got these lights for my 2001 Mitsubishi Montero. I mounted them to the front bumper with the help of a friend of mine. They are super bright, like, waaay brighter than even the vehicles headlights. Easy enough to install. They have been rained on and gone off roading through dense foliage with no problems so far. Great cheap lights.
customer_reviews.author: Minuteman

customer_reviews.title: Electric golf carts need power inverters
customer_reviews.text: Not gonna lie, I bought the kit with the 2 pods and the 20 in light bar and wired them straight to a 48v power system and blew out the pods. But when I figured out you need a 48v to 12v power inverter and hooked it up everything works fine. The pods are really bright at night, my grandma is really happy.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Not a real spot or driving  light
customer_reviews.text: these are very bright and illuminate the road good but they are much more of a flood light than a spot light. they light up the area in front of the car good and help you see whats on either side of you too, they also let you see what is in the trees as there is no cut off to stop light from going upwards. another good thing is they really make street signs stand out. This is about what I expected knowing how LEDs work, these need a better lens to send the light out further
customer_reviews.author: Greg Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great lights bad mounting hardware
customer_reviews.text: These lights are very bright, can’t install them because the mounting hardware is very odd in that they always point to the ground or the sky no matter how how you mount them. Luckily I am a welder, and powder coat as a hobby. I would suggest other mounting choices to the manufacturer and customer choice option
customer_reviews.author: John W

customer_reviews.title: Work great on a Husqvarna zero turn mower!
customer_reviews.text: Good for my use! I added these to my Husqvarna zero turn mower giving me the needed light for the very occasional mowing/other tasks in the dark. The Husqvarna light kit runs about $140, I added these lights for about $15. For this install they tied directly into the factory installed light switch. Im not sure on the quality, they look good but they are cheap, I would guess some corners were cut somewhere in manufacturing. They will be perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great lights!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 3 packs of these so far, and they really go the distance. The 4 I installed on my jeep are about a year old and work perfectly! So I decided to get a pair for my truck, and they look great! Very bright and have held up under all the weather you can imagine. Definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: Of course I bought the open box special description said they would be in original packaging and unused which was a complete lie so extremely good value for the price but whoever bought them previous to me tried to mount one and pulled the nut out But nothing I can’t fix haven’t put them up yet just tested them to make sure I worked
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Carnley

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and bright
customer_reviews.text: Got these on a flash deal. Have a set on my Jeep. They are pretty bright but I said let there be light and Amazon said here you go get another set for 10 bucks! I said OK! So now I can make night into day with a flick of a switch. They are bright and haven't had any led's burn out on my other set that are about a year old. Easy to install or tie in to existing lighting. Heavy duty too.
customer_reviews.author: LVMom32

customer_reviews.title: Great lights!! Can’t beat them!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended! I’ve bought 3 sets of Niilight lights for different vehicles and am very happy with them. I have them on my truck, tractor, and golf cart. Very bright and reliable. Can’t beat them for the price. Also highly recommend their harness. Super easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Mounting holes tapped in housing strip very easy.
customer_reviews.text: These are cheap. Even for the price they are very bad. The lights worked but the mounting holes tapped into the housing are very poor. The bolt would not hold the light to the bracket. They just kept turning and would never tighten. Would not recommend even at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: rsab72

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the price, but be aware the LEDs are only being driven at 1w each. This is bad for brightness but good for battery life. Total draw is right around 6-7w or half an amp on a 12v system. I can even power one directly from a cheap 15w solar panel on a cloudy day...great for inside a dark shed.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good Lights, Hardware Needs Work.
customer_reviews.text: The lights are small enough and put out a surprising amount of light, perfect as auxiliary lighting on my ATV. My issue is with the hardware. There are 4 small hex bolts that hold the light to the bracket. On the pair of lights that I received, the holes on the base of the lamp were not fully threaded so the bolts would bottom out with another eighth inch or so of thread remaining. I had a tap and die set on hand, so it was a simple fix, but something that should still be noted. I will also mention that this is for a pair of lights and the mounting brackets only, no switch or wiring are included.
customer_reviews.author: Glt68

customer_reviews.title: Each light only draws 1/2 amp at 12 volts.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Measured total current for both lights = 1 amp @ 12 volts. Each light separately draws 1/2 amp. LEDs are bright and spot - light focused. Although haven't installed on UTV yet, mounting kits look complete and lights came packaged well. Reminder that LEDs are voltage polarity sensitive. Won't damage if connected in reverse, but they only come ON if voltage polarity is correct.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright and great price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and bright. I have several sets of these on various tractors and my jeep CJ7. They are low amp draw so are perfect for the garden tractors or the snow blower. They are a flood light with a WIDE beam. They do not throw light very far but are perfect for a flood light. Great for snow blowers or garden tractors. They work okay on the JEEP for trail riding but not good for the road.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best LEDs in the Game
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a variety of different LED pods from Nilight with zero issues. Installation is always an easy process, with super bright lights being the result. Everyone comments, and all are surprised by the price. If you're looking for LEDs, choose Nilight.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: damaged when arrived
customer_reviews.text: Just received these today and I noticed the cooling fins on the back of one of the lights were bent in one spot. The packaging that the lights arrived in was not damaged at all which tells me the light was damaged before it was put into the box. I tested the lights and both work and are nice and bright. Cannot expect great quality from $14 lights. Curious to see how long they last....
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie LR

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product for the price, very bright!
customer_reviews.text: Great little off road pod lights. Some of the bolts that hold it all together were a little loose at delivery. I tightened all bolts before install to make sure it is water and dust proof. I wish the existing wire running from the lights was a little longer, not a lot to work with the ensure your connecting point is out of the open weather. But all around, very bright and great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect
customer_reviews.text: These lights look well built in all regards. Light output is very good, with the majority of the light concentrated in a spot beam, accompanied by a broad area of less intense illumination all around the focal spot. I would suggest they do a good job illuminating at distances of between 10' and 40'. Very white light color, a hint more warm white than blue, which Is easier on the eyes and more useful in my opinion. They consume 1.05A at 14V (each) so the power input is slightly less than advertised. No regrets whatsoever, a bargain for the performance you get.
customer_reviews.author: G. MCBROOM

customer_reviews.title: Great lights until.....
customer_reviews.text: extremely bright light and i loved them. I have 55w 5k HIDs on my truck and i can turn them off and these fog lights still light up the road very well. unfortunately they have water in them now and only 2 of the 6 cree lights work and they are still bright but not fully functional. I bought some Auxbeam lights to replace them and i sealed them with rtv clear silicone around the lens and the housing and all the screws so hopefully that keeps it dry and condensation free
customer_reviews.author: Barryn Burroughs

customer_reviews.title: Terrible packaging. Missing all mounting hardware and D-Rings
customer_reviews.text: The box was open and there were several parts missing. Most of the mounting hardware was missing. Both of the D rings were gone. Literally stuff was falling out of the box in the truck and while it was carried up the driveway. I'm super lucky I had extra hardware...
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Wittern

customer_reviews.title: With low beams on they light up the road about like my high beams
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. The adjustment and mounting hardware leaves a little to be desired. They are very bright to look at, but don't provide much for down road lighting. I have them wired in to my KC spotlights, and when I have my high beams and KC lights on, it completely drowns them out. With low beams on they light up the road about like my high beams, so not too bright, and not too far down road. If you are looking for extended down road lighting, I would not recommend them. So far, I have found nothing that compares to my KC spotlights for down road visibility.
customer_reviews.author: Bro. Robert. 32°

customer_reviews.title: Not as bright as expected for city not to mention off road
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my electric scooter to ride at night and I was disappointed they are not all thay bright I got a bike light that has 5xled and is way way brighter than 2 of these combined. I thought it was my 12v battery but after connecting to my car it's the same thing
customer_reviews.author: Tomnyc

customer_reviews.title: Best LED lights so far
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding LED pods. I bought these to replace the other pods I had, which were dimming down. Right away, I noticed a huge improvement with these pods over the old ones. These were packaged neatly and cleanly. The packaging showed the company cared about the product. My old pods, which I bought off amazon, were bigger, dimmer, more costly and were packaged loose-pack style in a bag with their hardware! These are great lights, super bright, super clean looking. I will buy these exact ones again.
customer_reviews.author: Angel S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Lights
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to install on my mower for a light help with night mowing. Overall not a bad set of lights my two biggest complaints are the the wire comes out the same side on both lights so it makes it hard to do a clean look on a mower. Secondly the adjustment screw for side to side movement is in a terrible spot you to take the light out of the mount to tighten it fully.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Derrow

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after 5 weeks of use.
customer_reviews.text: I installed these in December. I was riding g behind my wife and noticed the lights looked funky. Went up to check them and the mounting points were falling apart at the housing. All the hardware was rusted, the aluminum was showing signs of corrosion and one light had water in the lense... In 5 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: USMCSurvivalist85

customer_reviews.title: Extremely durable.
customer_reviews.text: Twenty five hundred miles across country, rain, wind and bouncing down every horrible road imaginable, even Oklahoma, which has the worst roads on Earth. They still work great. Never had to adjust them up or down. I use them to light up the road just ahead of my truck, the area missed by my factory headlights. Also have a larger pair in the back of my truck as a bed light system. Can't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: BUY THESE!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE LIGHTS. I bought them to replace my factory fog lights on a 95 Grand Cherokee. The brackets fit right inside the factory brackets! The wires are plenty long, and color coded and labeled for correct polarity. They are SO bright. I figured the lumens would be exaggerated. NOPE! These are 2X brighter than my faded old headlights. When aimed correctly, you'll get a nice medium flood with overlapping hot spot - like a proper head/fog light should have. All of my friends want these now. So far, I have run them any time I can think of an excuse to have my lights on.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R

product_meta.title: Nilight Led Pods 2PCS 18W 1260LM Spot Led Off Road Lights Super Bright Driving Fog Light Boat Lights Driving Lights Led Work Light SUV Jeep Lamp,2 Years Warranty
product_meta.description:
Size:2PCS 18W Led LightsSpecification: 
LED Power: 18W (6 x 3W High Intensity LED) 
Beam Pattern: Spot Beam; Lumen: 1260LM 
Input Voltage: 9-30V DC (fits 12V, 24V vehicles) 
Working Lifespan: Over 30,000 hours 
Working Temperature: -40~85 degrees Celsius 
LED Color Temperature: Pure White 6000K-6500K 
Material: 6063 Aluminum Profile, High quality Led Chips, PC Lens 
Waterproof Rate: IP67; Waterproof, dustproof, quakeproof and anti-corrosive. 
Certifications: CE, FCC and RoHS 
Applications: 
Off Road Lighting: Back Up Light, ATV, SUV, Truck, Trailer, Forklift, Trains, Boat, Outdoor lighting, etc. 
Other Lighting: Excavator, Dozer, Road Roller, Crane, Mining, Tractor, Harvester, Grain Drill, Fire engine, Rescue Vehicle, etc. 
Household Lighting: Garden, Backyard, Garage, Indoor Lighting. (Note: Use a voltage transformer/converter to convert the AC 110-120V to DC 12V.) 
Note: 
They are aftermarket parts. NOT D.O.T. approved. Do not use if D.O.T. is required. For off road use only. 
Before installing this product, please check your state/provincial and local/municipal laws and regulations.
feature_bullets: Super bright spot beam: High-quality LED chips emits bright white light; Concentrated spot beam illuminates to further distance and lumen is 1260LM
Adjustable mounting bracket: The pod can be adjusted to about 45 degrees, which makes changing direction of light beam easier.
Better heat dissipation: Special designed die-cast aluminum alloy cooling fins effectively extend the lifespan to over 30,000 hours.
Waterproof rate: IP67; waterproof up to 3.3 feet of water for 30 minutes and effectively dustproof.
Package include: 2PCS 18W LED Light Bars and Mounting Brackets
This product is the universal fit. It fit all the vehicles.
60001S- B and 60001S-A are the same products

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars8,638 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
